definitions.text: a wrong action attributable to bad judgment or ignorance or inattention
examples: she was quick to point out my errors
I could understand his English in spite of his grammatical faults

definitions.text: an imperfection in an object or machine
examples: a flaw caused the crystal to shatter
if there are any defects you should send it back to the manufacturer

definitions.text: the quality of being inadequate or falling short of perfection
examples: they discussed the merits and demerits of her novel
he knew his own faults much better than she did

definitions.text: (geology) a crack in the earth's crust resulting from the displacement of one side with respect to the other
examples: they built it right over a geological fault
he studied the faulting of the earth's crust

definitions.text: (electronics) equipment failure attributable to some defect in a circuit (loose connection or insulation failure or short circuit etc.)
examples: it took much longer to find the fault than to fix it

definitions.text: responsibility for a bad situation or event
(sports) a serve that is illegal (e.g., that lands outside the prescribed area)
examples: he served too many double faults

definitions.text: put or pin the blame on
